text: A seat of salt and splinters, hauled from the gut of the sea—too cursed even for Ulfric's hall.

Among the salt-stung Bjornling fleets, few ships are spoken of in such hushed awe as The Trawled Throne. A wide-bellied longship with warped ribs and an unnatural keel, she is said to have once dredged up a barnacle-encrusted throne from the seafloor off the jagged cliffs of Kronfjall—an immense seat of carved stone and rotted gold, engraved with runes no scholar has yet dared to translate.
The cold mists surrounding the longship lashes out at any who dare attack its hull, as if the vessel is defending itself.
Any who worship the Dark Gods are affected by the energy emanating from the star atop the longship.
Built from the driftwood of drowned trees and lashed with river-serpent hide, The Brinefang is as much a beast of the delta as the trolls it hunts, its hull streaked with salt and scars of battle.
A vessel swift enough to outrun even the serpents of the deep, its oars pull like the beating wings of a dragon.
No traitor has ever stepped aboard Geimdall's Kingship and lived to tell the tale—its hull carries the weight of Geimdall’s unwavering honor. Legends say that the very ship itself remembers betrayal.

Built from the driftwood of drowned trees and lashed with river-serpent hide, The Brinefang is as much a beast of the delta as the trolls it hunts, its hull streaked with salt and scars of battle.
A vessel swift enough to outrun even the serpents of the deep, its oars pull like the beating wings of a dragon.
The sharpened stakes surrounding the longship impale any who dare attack its hull, as if the vessel is defending itself.
With rythmic prowess the Longship's drummer dictates the tempo of collective assault and defence, molding the huscarls and marauders in to one organized horde.
With a blast of the war horn, the skies churn and the sea answers his call.
Dripping meat and steaming stew are hurled from the king’s ship—fuel for frenzied slaughter.
What Harald doesn’t eat, his warriors do—feasting mid-battle, their bloodlust stoked by bone and broth.
Wounded but unbroken, the longship belches forth warriors ready to die for their Jarl.
Spawns a unit of Shielded Marauders
Spawns a unit of Marauder Champions
As the hull cracks and blood runs, the Huscarls rise from below, axes eager for vengeance.
Few have the strength to break free once the Kraken has them within its horrid, betentacled grasp.
The sea is summoned, and a great tide coalesces upon the battlefield to drench all those that oppose the caster.
Some things should never rise above the waves or be seen by mortal eyes.
No troll escapes the Huntress’ net—its limbs tangled, its fate sealed by tooth and steel.
From the mist and grass, the Sarl hunters loose their arrows—seen only when the killing starts.
